name: TheAtlantic
text: When a Canadian province decided not save caribou habitat, the government had another solution: kill the wolves that preyed on them. But that plan was based on a flawed study, @aznfusion reports: https://t.co/bTy4IKyBrZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: ‚ÄúThe post-pandemic future of the United States is not preordained...We still get to make some fateful choices,‚Äù William J. Burns argues. ‚ÄúThe United States must choose from three broad strategic approaches: retrenchment, restoration, and reinvention.‚Äù https://t.co/9jHMJ34CbZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Festival has become the preeminent live exploration of the ideas that shape a changing nation, featuring conversations with those at the center of the biggest stories. This year‚Äôs festival, from September 21 to 24, is online and free to attend:https://t.co/S9UWOQ7imm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In the Title VII, DACA, and Louisiana abortion cases, the outcomes appeared to be progressive while the reasoning signaled forthcoming wins for the conservative legal movement," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/EImTQyArjg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If we in the 21st century are to remain true to [the Framers‚Äô] vision, we must find a way‚Äîindeed, many ways‚Äîto reinvent local journalism before it is too late," @Sulliview writes: https://t.co/alLFfyCUOZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: How does country‚Äîa genre in love with routine‚Äîrespond to a moment in which everyone‚Äôs lives have been disrupted? @skornhaber on how the music is being reshaped by our current era: https://t.co/dezKFAZw30

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Pandemics are complicated, but pandemic economics is simple. Get families cash, or people will go hungry and lose their home." --
Always read @DKThomp:
https://t.co/dGmpp8zsho

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The supposed trade-off between public health and the economy doesn‚Äôt exist. And right now, the country is choosing not to save either," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/9gndITlR1a

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Despite the sincere intentions of its author," @JohnHMcWhorter says of 'White Fragility,' "the book diminishes Black people in the name of dignifying us." https://t.co/8dW3vSe5cX

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Supreme Court ended its term last week, but our writers are still processing the decisions made in recent days‚Äîand what they signal for the Court‚Äôs future. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/Zqvc9KeD7V

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pandemics are unpredictable‚Äîthere's no way to know when the next one will arrive. The longer this one lasts, the less far-fetched the idea of a double pandemic feels, writes @edyong209: https://t.co/57VPWxFu4j

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: üö®This is what's keeping me up at night: What if a second pandemic happened on top of the current one? Here's an attempt to answer that question. The longer the US struggles against one virus, the more vulnerable it becomes to others. 1/ 

https://t.co/crPEQbCuRA

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: COVID-19 shows us what happens when even wealthy countries are inadequately prepared for rare but ruinous events. So we *have* to prepare for future ones--now. Further pandemics are inevitable: the question is when they'll hit. 

https://t.co/crPEQbCuRA

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The COVID-19-induced economic crisis is in danger of becoming a housing crisis. Data on rent payments are hard to come by, but one survey has found that a third of Americans say they failed to make a full housing payment in June," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/ZsvSecDxgG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch live: The coronavirus has exposed the longstanding inequities and deficiencies in our health-care system. Join @AtlanticLIVE for an online summit to discuss the future of health care with Anthony Fauci, @edyong209, @olgakhazan, and more. https://t.co/hRDrKVfa0g

name: TheAtlantic
text: Though Bruce Lee‚Äôs¬†enduring pop-culture image is that of a stoic, indestructible warrior, the five films he starred in during his lifetime portray him as a much more nuanced hero, @davidlsims writes: https://t.co/EGOgS4oFrB

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic made cities quiet; the Black Lives Matter protests made them loud again. Together, the two rekindle an old struggle for power over noise and who gets to make it, writes @mcmansionhell: https://t.co/zMxQsLz6hp

name: TheAtlantic
text: The coronavirus ‚Äúis interested only in whether it can find a warm, moist home in the back of your throat or nose. And, in June, too many Californians made those parts of their anatomy available,‚Äù @Bob_Wachter writes: https://t.co/ntDDefTZMt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Anthony Fauci tells @TheAtlantic that the White House's recent attacks against him are "bizarre," ‚Äúnonsense,‚Äù and ‚Äúcompletely wrong‚Äù:
https://t.co/ao3GjzuwFH

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PeterAtlantic: We asked Dr. Fauci about the WH document sent to reporters claiming he made inaccurate statements. He said it is "completely wrong. The whole thing is wrong. The whole thing is incorrect."
Why did the White House do this? we asked.
"I don‚Äôt know."

https://t.co/nVQMnaayNm

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: In which Anthony Fauci is extremely honest about the recent White House attacks against him. Spend some time with this @edyong209 + @PeterAtlantic mega-interview: https://t.co/upybXOamWI

text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Fauci isn't holding back. (He also says America needs to have a "reset" moment to course correct our miserable pandemic response.) https://t.co/K0SMdjC3pH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: In his private meeting with White House chief of staff Mark Meadows, Anthony Fauci didn't get an apology over the WH's release of the oppo-style attack on him. Meadows told Fauci he hadn't known about it. https://t.co/nVQMnaayNm

text: RT @AdrienneLaF: The scariest part is that @edyong209 has a long history of being right about pandemics. https://t.co/eYvlvZhYiu

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: Despite the White House attacks, Dr. Fauci tells us he will not resign. He believes he's doing important work combating the virus and is not about to stop. https://t.co/nVQMnaayNm

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ever since America‚Äôs shutdown began, almost all styles of music have lost streaming listenership. Country‚Äôs popularity, on the other hand, has risen, Spencer Kornhaber writes. https://t.co/e5QR88Rphf

name: TheAtlantic
text: ‚ÄúThe next, terrifying phase of the coronavirus recession is here: a damaged economy, a virus spreading faster than it was in March,‚Äù @AnnieLowrey writes. https://t.co/hNHZFth8Ay

name: TheAtlantic
text: ‚ÄúJust because I‚Äôm aware of the destruction caused by racism, that doesn‚Äôt mean I‚Äôm automatically sensitive to other forms of racism,‚Äù @jemelehill writes. ‚ÄúThe unfortunate truth is that Black Americans have shown a certain cultural blindspot about Jews.‚Äù https://t.co/sUwQzm1ptr
